SOS do naval de Ferrol despois de 500 despedimentos
Agárdanse outros 1.500 no vindeiro verán, cando Navantia quede sen traballo // Uns 2.500 operarios da principal, auxiliares e prexubilados marchan en reclamación dun buque AOR
07 Nov 2019 by PATRICIA HERMIDA. FERROL   
Baixo a chuvia inclemente de Ferrol, o naval protagonizou este xoves a súa enésima mobilización. Acumula case 500 despedimentos nas auxiliares, a carga de traballo esgotarase definitivamente o vindeiro verán cos dous buques para Australia. E para entón prevense outros 1.500 despedimentos, xa que as fragatas F-110 non se inician ata febreiro de 2022. Nunha cidade nacida á sombra dos estaleiros, iso implica unha nova crise económica de case dous anos por diante. Máis de 2.500 operarios de Navantia, auxiliares e prexubilados marcharon desde a factoría ata o edificio da Xunta. Piden á administración autonómica que se implique na reclamación ao goberno central dun buque de apoio loxístico ou AOR, que paliaría a desocupación ata 2022.
“Xa entramos en subactividade, os talleres de aceiros están parados salvo os bloques para reparacións... e toda a auxiliar marchará para a rúa sen data de volta, iso é o que máis dano fai”, indica Miguel Pol, voceiro do comité de Navantia-Ferrol. Os operarios entregaron no edificio da Xunta 4.000 sinaturas, “para que se implique onde ten competencias, como a fábrica de turbinas que pode ser un puntal para a eólica europea ou as inversións en reparacións”. Denuncian que “as F-110 retrasáronse por intereses políticos e agora na comarca volveremos ás taxas de paro de hai catro anos, ata chegar a un 30%”.
Xa desde febreiro houbo protestas para reclamar esa carga de traballo: “Pedimos un AOR porque xa ten a enxeñería consolidada por encargos similares e o corte de chapa pode iniciarse en poucos meses, ademáis a Armada necesita ese barco”. Os traballadores rexeitan as últimas declaracións do PSOE, que indicaba que o AOR non e unha necesidade para o Ministerio de Defensa. Segundo o comité de Navantia, “a responsabilidade do partido do goberno é comprometerse con Ferrolterra”.
Lamentan desde o comité “a irresponsabilidade do PSOE e do PP, na pasada crise vivimos a emigración de profesionais e aínda hoxe temos un desempreo desproporcionado... iso é un fracaso político do máis alto nivel”. Ademáis avisan sobre a “posible destrución do tecido industrial que rodea ao naval, ou se implican as administracións ou teremos un deserto industrial”. O primeiro buque australiano entregarase en febreiro de 2020 e o segundo no verán, quedan activas reparacións e turbinas (con caixas reductoras para as corbetas árabes).
Á manifestación acudiron representantes políticos como Yolanda Díaz (candidata ao Congreso por Galicia en Común-Unidas Podemos), que acusou á ministra de Defensa en funcións de “presumir de ter carga de traballo e agora vemos que faltou á verdade, pois temos fortes despedimentos nas auxiliares e esta comarca non ten futuro sen o naval”. Para o deputado do BNG, Xosé Luis Rivas ‘Mini’, “é un despilfarro ver a tanta xente capacitada sen carga de traballo, estamos ante unha barbaridade que Ferrolterra non se merece”.
text:
SOS of Ferrol's naval after 500 dismissals
Another 1,500 are expected next summer, when Navantia is out of work // About 2,500 primary, auxiliary and retired workers march in claim of an AOR vessel
07 Nov 2019 by PATRICIA HERMIDA. FERROL
Under the heavy rain of Ferrol, the naval carried out this Thursday its umpteenth mobilization. Accumulating nearly 500 layoffs in the auxiliaries, the workload will definitely be exhausted next summer with the two ships to Australia. And by that time another 1,500 layoffs are planned, as the F-110 frigates do not start until February 2022. In a city born in the shadow of shipyards, this implies a new economic crisis almost two years ahead. More than 2,500 Navantia workers, auxiliaries and retirees marched from the factory to the Xunta building. They call on the autonomous administration to be involved in the claim to the central government of a logistical support vessel or AOR, which would alleviate unemployment by 2022.
"We have already entered into sub-activity, the steel workshops are stopped except the blocks for repairs ... and all the auxiliary will march to the street without a date back, that's the most damage it does," says Miguel Pol, spokesman of the committee of Navantia-Ferrol. The operators delivered 4,000 signatures in the Xunta's building, "so that it involves where it has competences, such as the turbine plant that can be a mainstay for European wind power or investments in repairs." They denounce that "the F-110s have been delayed due to political interests and now in the region we will return to the unemployment rates of four years ago, up to 30%."
Already since February there have been protests to claim that workload: "We asked for an AOR because it already has the engineering consolidated by similar orders and the sheet metal cutting can be started in a few months, besides the Navy needs that boat." The workers reject the latest statements from the PSOE, stating that the AOR is not a necessity for the Ministry of Defense. According to the Navantia committee, "the responsibility of the government party is to compromise with Ferrolterra".
They regret from the committee "the irresponsibility of the PSOE and the PP, in the last crisis we live the emigration of professionals and even today we have a disproportionate unemployment ... this is a political failure of the highest level". They also warn of the "possible destruction of the industrial fabric surrounding the naval, or the administrations are involved or we will have an industrial desert." The first Australian ship will be delivered in February 2020 and the second in the summer, with active repairs and turbines (with gearboxes for the Arabian corvettes) still active.
The rally was attended by political representatives such as Yolanda Díaz (candidate for the Congress for Galicia in Común-Unidas Podemos), who accused the acting minister of defense of "presuming to have workload and now we see that the truth is missing, as we have strong dismissals in the auxiliaries and this region has no future without the naval ”. For the BNG deputy, Xosé Luis Rivas 'Mini', "it is a waste to see so many people trained without workload, we are facing a barbarity that Ferrolterra does not deserve."
